Description: Ho'okipa Beach is a go-to surfing spot on Maui. This North Shore beach sets perfect conditions with north, northwest, west, and east swells. It's also a world-class windsurfing destination.
Fun reef breaks for riders of all levels make Lahaina a great place to surf on the west coast of the island.
Get ready to catch the longest ride of your life! Honolua Bay is one of the best surf spots in Hawaii, boasting a powerful, hollow reef break point and a world-class wave.

With a nickname like “Jaws Beach”, it’s no surprise that Pe’ahi on the North Shore is the most powerful surf spot on Maui. Its massive, fast-moving waves make Jaws strictly for professional surfers only.
Just off the Honoapiilani Highway, Olowalu is the easiest spot to access on the island. You can literally go from driving the highway to dropping in on a wave in two minutes.
